001/*

004 * See LICENSE for details.
005*/
006
007package renderer.scene.primitives;
008
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011
012/**
013   A {@code Face} object has a list of integers that represent
014   the endpoints of a closed loop of line segments. The integers
015   are indices into the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list of
016   a {@link renderer.scene.Model} object.
017<p>
018   A {@code Face} is closed loop of line segments that is assumed
019   to be "flat" and "convex".
020<p>
021   Flat means that the vertices of the {@code Face} all lie in
022   the same plane.
023<p>
024   Convex means that a line segment joining any two vertices of
025   the {@code Face} must be completely contained inside of the
026   {@code Face}.
027<p>
028   The combination of flat and convex means that we can give a
029   {@code Face} an orientation and we can determine if the
030   {@code Face} if "front facing" or "back facing".
031*/
032public class Face extends OrientablePrimitive
033{
034   /**
035      Construct an empty {@code Face}.
036   */
037   public Face()
038   {
039      super();
040   }
041
042
043   /**
044      Construct a {@code Face} with the given array of indices for
045      the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
046      <p>
047      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
048      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
049      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
050      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
051      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
052
053      @param indices  array of {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} indices to place in this {@code Face}
054   */
055   public Face(final int... indices)
056   {
057      super(indices);
058   }
059
060
061   /**
062      Construct a {@code Face} object using the two given
063      {@link List}s of integer indices.
064      <p>
065      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
066      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
067      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
068      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
069      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
070
071      @param vIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
072      @param cIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
073      @throws NullPointerException if {@code vIndexList} is {@code null}
074      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList} is {@code null}
075      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code vIndexList} and {@code cIndexList} are not the same size
076   */
077   public Face(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
078               final List<Integer> cIndexList)
079   {
080      super(vIndexList, cIndexList);
081   }
082
083
084   /**
085      Construct a {@code Face} object using the three given
086      {@link List}s of integer indices.
087      <p>
088      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
089      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
090      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
091      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
092      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
093
094      @param vIndexList   {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
095      @param cIndexList   {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
096      @param cIndexList2  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
097      @throws NullPointerException if {@code vIndexList} is {@code null}
098      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList} is {@code null}
099      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList2} is {@code null}
100      @throws IllegalArgumentException if the size of any one of the index lists is not 3
101   */
102   public Face(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
103               final List<Integer> cIndexList,
104               final List<Integer> cIndexList2)
105   {
106      super(vIndexList, cIndexList, cIndexList2);
107   }
108
109
110   /**
111      For debugging.
112
113      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code Face} object
114   */
115   @Override
116   public String toString()
117   {
118      String result =  "Face: ([";
119      for (int i = 0; i < vIndexList.size() - 1; ++i)
120      {
121         result += vIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
122      }
123      result += vIndexList.get(vIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
124      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList.size() - 1; ++i)
125      {
126         result += cIndexList.get(i) + ", ";
127      }
128      result += cIndexList.get(cIndexList.size() - 1) + "], [";
129      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList2.size() - 1; ++i)
130      {
131         result += cIndexList2.get(i) + ", ";
132      }
133      result += cIndexList2.get(cIndexList2.size() - 1) + "])\n";
134      return result;
135   }
136}
